entry.title: Myanmar‚Äôs Rohingya people called ‚ÄòMuslim dogs‚Äô before attacks, ICJ hears
entry.summary: Hearings continued on Thursday at the UN‚Äôs top court into The Gambia‚Äôs claim that Myanmar committed genocide against the Rohingya people, with allegations that military officials incited violence by calling the ethnic minority ‚ÄúMuslim dogs‚Äù who should be made ‚Äúextinct‚Äù.

entry.title: Japan and the Philippines sign a new defense pact as they face growing China aggression
entry.summary: Japan and the Philippines have signed a defense pact that will allow the tax-free provision of ammunition, fuel, food and other necessities when their forces stage joint training to boost deterrence against China‚Äôs growing aggression in the region and to bolster their preparation for natural disaste

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: China drafting purchase rules for Nvidia H200 chips, Nikkei Asia reports
entry.summary: China is working to set rules on how many advanced artificial intelligence chip companies can buy from foreign makers such as Nvidia , Nikkei Asia reported on Thursday, citing two people familiar with the matter.

entry.title: Alibaba upgrades Qwen app to order food, book travel
entry.summary: Alibaba on Thursday launched significant upgrades to its Qwen artificial intelligence app, saying it could now execute tasks such as order food delivery and make travel bookings as it more aggressively pushes into consumer-facing AI.

entry.title: Woolly rhino genome recovered from frozen wolf's stomach
entry.summary:
The woolly rhinoceros is an extinct species of rhinoceros that was common throughout Europe and northern Asia during the Pleistocene epoch. Scientists recently sequenced the genome of a woolly rhino from the tissue found inside a frozen 14,400-year-old wolf. The work marks the first time an Ice Age animal‚Äôs complete genome has been recovered from tissue preserved inside another ancient animal.
In 2011, mammoth ivory hunters in northeastern Siberia discovered a mummified wolf puppy that had lain frozen for 14,400 years. An autopsy of the permafrost-preserved pup revealed another surprise: its gut contained chunks of grayish meat covered with strands of golden hair.
‚ÄúThe tissue was so intact, it looked like the wolf had just swallowed it before it died,‚Äù says Camilo Chac√≥n-Duque‚Ä¶

Trump's greenlight for Nvidia AI chips to China draws fire from lawmakers, former officials
entry.summary: U.S. lawmakers and former officials on Wednesday questioned President Donald Trump's decision to allow Nvidia to sell its second most powerful AI chips in China, arguing the move erodes America's AI edge and threatens to electrify Beijing's military.

entry.title: How the Romans became the greatest builders in the ancient world
entry.summary:
The Roman world was bound to the capital by the invisible web of law and custom, and a tangible network of roads, aqueducts, sewers, and ports. This spectacle of infrastructure, whose ruins still provoke awe, proclaimed Rome‚Äôs preeminence across Europe, the Middle East, and North Africa.
Engineering was one of Rome‚Äôs most lasting legacies. Adopting technologies already invented by the Greeks, Etruscans, Egyptians, and Babylonians, the Romans refined them with their own utilitarian spirit.
Utility, or utilitas, was central to Roman thinking. Vitruvius, the first-century B.C. Roman engineer, architect, and theorist, reflected on his admiration for the mathematicians and engineers on whom Roman greatness was built: ‚Äúmen whose researches are an everlasting possession, not only for th‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ride the world's steepest cable-car to this remote Swiss village
entry.summary:
This article was produced by National Geographic Traveller (UK).
Only in Switzerland can you speed down a slope racing against a train. Skiing Jungfrau‚Äôs piste 36 brings me alongside the distinctive red carriages of a Jungfrau Railway train, its locomotive whirring as I sweep down the piste, carving turns to steady my velocity just as the cogs on the train control its speed on the steep descent. And at the bottom, in Wengen, there‚Äôs time to get myself a coffee and strudel before taking the train back up, observing other people‚Äôs technique ‚Äî or lack of it.
If you‚Äôre itching for action, that ride back up, however congenial, can feel a bit slow. But from this winter, the long-awaited completion of the vertigo-inducing Schilthornbahn 20XX cable-car offers a fast-track to explore Ju‚Ä¶

entry.title: HPV is more common‚Äîand misunderstood‚Äîthan you think
entry.summary:
Colorized transmission electron microscopy (TEM) of human papillomavirus (HPV) particles. This common virus can infect various parts of the body, with some instances causing cervical, vulvar, and vaginal cancers. This sexually transmitted infection is almost entirely preventable. Here's what experts say you really need to know to protect yourself.
Nearly¬†every American¬†will¬†contract the¬†human papillomavirus (HPV) in their lifetime, and over 40 million Americans currently have HPV. Globally,¬†hundreds of thousands¬†of cancer cases annually are attributed to the virus.¬†With over 200 strains, ‚ÄúHPV infection is just so common and so ubiquitous,‚Äù says¬†June Hou, a gynecologic oncologist at Columbia University Irving Medical Center.¬†
Here‚Äôs what HPV is, how it spreads, and what the sci‚Ä¶

entry.title: 9 spectacular state parks to visit this winter
entry.summary:
Travelers looking for less crowded alternatives to U.S. National Parks should consider visiting state parks such as Utah‚Äôs 5,362-acre Dead Horse Point State Park, which features an overlook of the Colorado River and Canyonlands National Park. From ice fishing to toboggan racing to skiing in a ghost town, winter adventures hit differently in these less-crowded alternatives to national parks.
Winter strips landscapes down to their essentials‚Äîquiet, contour, light‚Äîand in that stillness, America‚Äôs State Parks reveal a different kind of drama. Unlike spring, summer, and autumn, when crowds clamor along boardwalks and struggle to see wildlife and fall foliage amid so many people, cold-weather months usually attract fewer visitors.
However, as wonderful as it is to explore a park in ‚Ä¶

entry.title: What is black ice? The science behind the winter threat
entry.summary: A woman tries to regain balance in icy conditions on her way to work to avoid falling on black ice. An estimated 1 million people are injured from slipping on ice and snow across the U.S. each year, leading to serious issues like broken bones and head injuries, with around 17,000 of these falls proving fatal, according to statistics from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Nearly invisible and deceptively thin, this ice is one of winter‚Äôs deadliest hazards. Here‚Äôs how it forms and why it causes thousands of accidents each year. When the weather is calling for¬†winter storms, drivers know to prepare for roads with slippery sleet and¬†snow. But there is an invisible hazard that can‚Ä¶

entry.title: The best night-sky apps, according to the experts
entry.summary:
These apps and recommendations from experts will help you learn about what you're seeing when you gaze up at the night sky. Hoping for a glimpse of the Milky Way? These user-friendly apps help stargazers learn more about objects in the sky, check visibility for prime Milky Way viewing, or even locate the International Space Station.
Where was I when a magenta aurora borealis could be seen as far south as Florida? Indoors and not paying enough attention. Thankfully, there are multiple apps for that.
‚ÄúMany visitors come to Dark Sky Parks for a chance to see the Milky Way, since 80 percent of Americans can't see it from their hometown,‚Äù says Jackie Rabb, a Mesa Verde National Park ranger and night sky lead at this certified International Dark Sky Park. Apps can help you ‚Äúfigure o‚Ä¶

entry.title: Global grain traders' green pledges face skepticism as deal to protect Brazil's rainforest unravels

entry.title: The UN is ‚Äòworth fighting for‚Äô: General Assembly President
entry.summary: With the multilateral system under pressure and under attack, Member States must fight for the United Nations, the President of the General Assembly said on Wednesday, laying out her priorities for its resumed 80th session.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Yemen‚Äôs fragile calm unravels as hunger and aid restrictions deepen crisis
entry.summary: A fragile political calm in Yemen is fraying, with renewed instability and aid restrictions deepening hunger, illness and displacement for millions of civilians, senior UN officials warned the Security Council on Wednesday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: East Jerusalem: Forced shutdown of UN clinic signals escalating disregard for international law
entry.summary: The temporary closure of a UN-run health centre in East Jerusalem is the latest phase in ‚Äúa pattern of deliberate disregard‚Äù for international law, the head of the UN agency that assists Palestine refugees, UNRWA, said on Wednesday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: 11-year streak of record global warming continues, UN weather agency warns
entry.summary: The past 11 years have been the warmest in the modern era, while oceans continue to heat up, too, says the UN weather agency.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Global employment stable but decent jobs in short supply
entry.summary: Global unemployment remains stable, but progress toward decent work has stalled, according to a new report from the International Labour Organization (ILO), which warns that young people continue to struggle in a job market which risks being further undermined by AI and trade policy uncertainty.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Russia's Lavrov says the U.S. is smashing the world around with its raid on Venezuela and threats to Iran
entry.summary: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday that the United States was fragmenting the very international system which Washington helped to create by undertaking what he said was an illegal operation to topple Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro and by threatening Iran with attack.

entry.title: Morning Bid: Shop till you drop
entry.summary: By Marc Jones, global markets correspondent

entry.title: Explainer: Why Japan's Takaichi is gambling on an early election
entry.summary: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi plans to dissolve parliament's lower house next week, triggering a national election to decide all 465 seats in her first major election test since taking office in October.

entry.title: US Supreme Court does not issue ruling on Trump's tariffs
entry.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court issued three decisions on Wednesday but did not decide the closely watched dispute over the legality of President Donald Trump's global tariffs.

entry.title: Canada and China: A half-century journey from Pierre Trudeau to Mark Carney
entry.summary: Canada was one of the first Western countries to recognize communist China, establishing ties in 1970 under Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: China's Xpeng aims to sell up to 600,000 vehicles in 2026
entry.summary: Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng is targeting sales of 550,000-600,000 vehicles this year, Chinese tech portal 36Kr reported on Wednesday, citing a recent internal strategy meeting.

entry.title: Exclusive: Beijing tells Chinese firms to stop using US and Israeli cybersecurity software
entry.summary: Chinese authorities have told domestic companies to stop using cybersecurity software made by roughly a dozen firms from the U.S. and Israel due to national security concerns, two people ‚Äåbriefed on the matter said.

entry.title: Venezuelan oil exports to China set to drop as US blockade limits cargoes
entry.summary: China's oil imports from Venezuela are expected to slump starting from February as fewer tankers have managed to leave for Caracas' top crude buyer after the U.S. claimed control of the OPEC producer, traders and analysts said.

entry.title: Iran warns of retaliation if Trump strikes, US withdraws some personnel from bases
entry.summary: The United States is withdrawing some personnel from bases in the Middle East, a U.S. official said on Wednesday, after a senior Iranian official said Tehran had warned neighbours it would hit American bases if Washington strikes.

entry.title: Meet the Galapague√±os who are trying to save paradise
entry.summary:
The Gal√°pagos are home to both incredible wildlife, such as great blue herons, and a band of locals, who protect them. The Gal√°pagos may be famed for its giant tortoises and blue-footed boobies, but its people are just as extraordinary. From naturalists and park guards to farmers and biologists, meet the Gal√°pague√±os safeguarding this fragile paradise for future generations.
This article was produced by National Geographic Traveller (UK).
Why did the giant tortoise cross the road? To hold up a busload of tourists, it seems. This one is standing in the middle of the barely gravelled track, casting a slow, menacing side-eye that suggests we must wait as long as it takes. I loop my camera around my neck and rush to the front of the bus ‚Äî though this isn‚Äôt exactly a blink-and-yo‚Ä¶

entry.title: Chinese firm FountainVest gets Italy's nod to buy stake in EuroGroup Laminations
entry.summary: Chinese private equity firm FountainVest has secured the Italian government's approval to buy a major stake in EuroGroup Laminations , a document showed, under a plan to take the electric motor component maker private.

entry.title: Audi misses sales target despite strong end to the year
entry.summary: Audi fell just short of its 2025 sales target despite a strong final quarter, the Volkswagen-owned premium carmaker said on Wednesday, citing U.S. tariffs and a highly competitive market.

entry.title: China's vehicle sales, exports set to cool in 2026
entry.summary: China's vehicle sales and exports are headed for a slowdown amid sluggish demand and lingering external uncertainties, a major Chinese industry association said on Wednesday.

entry.title: China‚Äôs car exports surged in 2025, but domestic demand slowed
entry.summary: China has reported its auto exports rose 21% last year from the year before, driven by a surge in electric vehicle shipments.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: Nestle CEO apologises over infant formula recall
entry.summary: Nestle CEO Philipp Navratil has apologised over the recall in dozens of countries of some batches of the firm's infant nutrition products, a setback which dealt a fresh blow to the Swiss consumer goods giant after a challenging 2025.

entry.title: Exclusive: Indonesian ride-hailing industry set for shake-up under draft presidential decree
entry.summary: Millions of Indonesian ride-hailing drivers would receive major increases to financial and social benefits under a draft decree being considered by President Prabowo Subianto, two sources said, threatening the profitability of ride-sharing platforms in their largest market in Southeast Asia.

entry.title: China's 2025 trade with Russia posts first decline in 5 years
entry.summary: China's trade with Russia in 2025 pulled back from a record level in 2024 and dropped for the first time in five years, Chinese data showed on Wednesday.

entry.title: Exclusive: China's customs agents told Nvidia's H200 chips are not permitted
entry.summary: Chinese customs authorities told customs agents this week that Nvidia's H200 artificial intelligence chips are not permitted to enter China, according to three people briefed on the matter.

entry.title: Saks Global's architect Richard Baker walks away from checkered legacy
entry.summary: Baker has had a long career at the intersection of retail and real estate investment, including some big early wins and, more recently, some crushing losses.

entry.title: China's 2025 Canadian trade slump to remind visiting Carney of economic stakes
entry.summary: China bought fewer goods from Canada last year for the first time since 2020, according to Chinese data released hours before a visit by the Canadian prime minister, in a stark reminder of the economic leverage Beijing has over Ottawa.

entry.title: The UK is expected to approve a ‚Äòmega‚Äô Chinese embassy in London despite objections
entry.summary: Britain‚Äôs government is expected to approve a large Chinese embassy near London‚Äôs financial district.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: Cambodia to keep up crackdown on scam centres after arrest of alleged mastermind
entry.summary: Cambodia's arrest of alleged scam centre kingpin Chen Zhi and his extradition to China was "not the end" of the Southeast Asian nation's battle to stamp out trans-border crimes, its foreign minister said.

entry.title: Cambodia says Thai troops still occupy civilian areas, testing December truce
entry.summary: Thailand's military continues to occupy civilian areas in Cambodia, having barricaded some with barbed wire and shipping containers, posing a risk to a truce between the neighbours who clashed twice last year, the Cambodian foreign minister said.

entry.summary: A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee

entry.title: A construction crane falls onto a moving train in Thailand, killing at least 22 people
entry.summary: A construction crane fell onto a moving passenger train, causing a fiery derailment that killed at least 22 people Wednesday in northeastern Thailand.

entry.title: Taiwan seeks arrest of Chinese smartphone maker OnePlus CEO over illegal hires
entry.summary: Taiwan prosecutors have issued an arrest warrant for the chief executive officer of Chinese smartphone maker OnePlus, alleging he was involved in illegal business and recruitment activities in Taiwan.

entry.title: China's 2025 rare earth exports hit highest since at least 2014 despite restrictions
entry.summary: China's rare earth exports in 2025 hit the highest level since at least 2014, even as Beijing began restricting shipments of several medium to heavy elements from April.

entry.title: Chinese dealers call for auto brands to balance inventory levels to help ease glut
entry.summary: Some Chinese auto brands are continuing to push excess inventories to dealers, the country's car dealers' association said, urging them to correct the practice to improve the industry's health.

entry.title: At least 25 killed after crane falls on train in Thailand, police say
entry.summary: A train derailed in northeastern Thailand on Wednesday after a construction crane fell on three of its carriages, killing at least 25 people and injuring about 80, police said.

entry.title: China‚Äôs trade surplus surges 20% to a record $1.2 trillion, even with Trump‚Äôs tariffs
entry.summary: China has reported its trade surplus surged to a record of almost $1.2 trillion last year as exports to other countries made up for slowing shipments to the United States under President Donald Trump.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: China's trade ends 2025 with record $1.2 trillion surplus despite Trump tariff jolt
entry.summary: China on Wednesday reported a record trade surplus of nearly $1.2 trillion in 2025, led by booming exports to non-U.S. markets as producers looked to build global scale to fend off sustained pressure from the Trump administration.

entry.title: Global EV sales growth likely to slow after 20% jump in rocky 2025, research firm says
entry.summary: Global EV registrations grew 20% last year but are likely to lose pace in 2026, data showed on Wednesday, as a slowdown in China and a relaxation of electrification targets worldwide led in December to the smallest sales increase since February 2024.

ÂΩìÁÑ∂ÔºåÊΩòÂÆáÊâ¨‰πüÂÖ±‰∫´ AI Âèô‰∫ãÂ∏¶Êù•ÁöÑ ‚ÄúÈ´ò‰º∞ÂÄº‚ÄùÔºå‰ªñ‰ªäÂπ¥ 7 ÊúàÂá∫Êù•Âàõ‰∏öÔºåÁªÑ‰∫Ü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂçÅÂá†‰∫∫ÁöÑÂ∞èÂõ¢ÈòüÔºåÁõÆÂâçÂ∑≤Áªè‰ª•ÊûÅÂø´ÁöÑÈÄüÂ∫¶ÊãøÂà∞‰∫Ü‰∏çËè≤ÁöÑÊäïËµÑÂíå‰∏çÈîôÁöÑ‰º∞ÂÄº„ÄÇ
ËøôÁ¶ª‰∏çÂºÄ‰ªñËøáÂéªÁöÑÂ±•ÂéÜ„ÄÇ‰ªñÊØï‰∏öÂêéÂ∞±Âéª‰∫ÜÂçé‰∏∫ÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéË∑≥Âà∞Â≠óËäÇÔºåÂèÇ‰∏éËøá AI Agent Âπ≥Âè∞ Coze ÁöÑ‰ªé 0 Âà∞ 1ÔºåËøòÂÅöËøá AI ÁúºÈïú„ÄÅË±ÜÂåÖÊâãÊú∫„ÄÇ‰Ωú‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™ 97 Âπ¥Âá∫Áîü„ÄÅË¢´ÊäïËµÑ‰∫∫ÂΩí‰∏∫ ‚ÄúÂ∞èÂ§©Êâç‚Äù Á±ªÁöÑÂàõ‰∏öËÄÖÔºåÊΩòÂÆáÊâ¨‰∏çÁº∫‰πèËÆ≤Ëø∞ AI ÊïÖ‰∫ãÁöÑËÉΩÂäõ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂ¶ÇÊûúËØöÂÆû‰∏ÄÁÇπÔºå‰ªñËßâÂæóËøôÂè™ÊòØÂØπÊäïËµÑ‰∫∫ËÆ≤Ëø∞ÁöÑÊïÖ‰∫ãÁöÑ B Èù¢ÔºåËÄåÂàõ‰∏öËÄÖÁªàÁ©∂ÈúÄË¶ÅÈù¢ÂØπÁöÑÊòØËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÁî®Êà∑Ôºå‰ªñÂøÖÈ°ªÂëäËØâÂ§ßÂÆ∂Ôºå‰∏Ä‰∏™Ë¥≠‰π∞ AI Á°¨‰ª∂ÁöÑÊòéÁ°ÆÁêÜÁî±„ÄÇ
ÊΩòÂÆáÊâ¨ÂÅöÁöÑÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âêç‰∏∫ Odyss ÁöÑ AI È°πÈìæÔºåÂÆÉÁöÑÊòéÁ°ÆÁöÑ‰ª∑ÂÄºÂú®‰∫éÔºöÂà©Áî®Â§öÊ®°ÊÄÅËßÜËßâÂ§ßÊ®°ÂûãÁöÑËÉΩÂäõÔºåËÆ∞ÂΩïÂíåÂàÜÊûêÁî®Êà∑ÂêÉËøõÂò¥ÈáåÁöÑÊØè‰∏ÄÂè£‰∏úË•øÔºå‰∏∫ÂÅ•Â∫∑È•ÆÈ£üÊèê‰æõËÆ∞ÂΩïÂíåÊåáÂØº„ÄÇ

entry.title: 'Are you dead?' Chinese app for single living goes viral
entry.summary: An app called "Are you dead" targeted at people living alone has gone viral in China, with surging downloads and widespread commentary on social media, prompting the company to introduce a subscription fee and change its name for a global audience.

entry.title: Bolted inside a steel sphere deep underwater, these explorers made history
entry.summary:
This story originally published in the June 1931 issue of¬†National Geographic¬†magazine.¬†See more digitized stories from our archives here.
Several years ago I climbed overboard into the clear waters of Haiti, and after a copper helmet had been lowered over my head and shoulders I slid slowly down a rope two, four, eight, ten fathoms and finally at sixty-three feet my canvas shoes settled into the soft ooze near a coral reef. I made my way to a steep precipice, balanced on the brink, and looked down, down into the green depths where illumination like moonlight showed waving sea-fans and milling fish far beyond the length of my hose.
It would have been exceedingly unwise to go much farther, for the steady force of the weight of water at ten fathoms had already increased the pressu‚Ä¶

entry.title: See a ghost 'fairyland' forest reemerge in Florida
entry.summary:
A snorkeler explores the fish-filled depths of Tobacco Patch Spring, one of at least 20 springs that were lost when the Rodman Reservoir was created by damming Florida's Ocklawaha River. Tobacco Patch and the other springs are normally submerged beneath the dark waters of the reservoir, but a few of them become visible during periodic drawdowns. Sixty years ago, these freshwater springs and forests were drowned by a 9,500-acre reservoir. Could the ecosystem finally be restored?
On New Year‚Äôs morning, Captain Erika Ritter wakes before dawn in the cabin on Florida‚Äôs Ocklawaha River her grandfather built in 1937 out of pine logs and cypress timber from the nearby swamp. She operates river tours aboard her pontoon boat, ‚ÄúThe Anhinga Spirit,‚Äù and has to prepare for back-to-back charters‚Ä¶

entry.title: Japan PM readies snap election, February 8 ballot eyed
entry.summary: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi plans to dissolve parliament next week and call a snap parliamentary election, the secretary general of her party said on Wednesday, as she seeks public backing for spending plans that have rattled financial markets.

entry.summary: President Donald Trump has once again drawn his go-to diplomatic weapon ‚Äî tariffs ‚Äî to coerce the Iranian government to end its bloody crackdown on nationwide protests.

entry.summary: The push by Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, who arrives Wednesday, is part of a major rethink as ties sour with the U.S. ‚Äî the world's No. 1 economy and long the largest trading partner for Canada by far.

entry.title: Welcome to La Panarda, one of the world‚Äôs most epic feasts
entry.summary:
In Europe‚Äôs most food-obsessed country, the season of excess has finished. Across Italy, families have finished the panettone, slurped down tortellini, and consumed platefuls of lentils‚Äîa tradition to augur good luck for the new year.¬†
But as the country winds down from its festive feasts, one small village in Abruzzo, a mountainous region in central-southern Italy, is preparing to eat like never before.
Every January 16, Villavallelonga, a village in the mountains of the Parco Nazionale d‚ÄôAbruzzo (Lazio e Molise),¬†Italy‚Äôs oldest national park, will hold its annual Panarda, a vast feast for the entire community.
Around 80 families in the village of just 900 residents spend days preparing multicourse spreads of up to 50 dishes to share with friends and family, so that n‚Ä¶

entry.title: What the science really says about colostrum supplements
entry.summary:
Colostrum is essential for newborn immune development‚Äîbut evidence that it offers the same benefits to adults remains limited. Marketed as ‚Äúliquid gold‚Äù for gut and immune health, colostrum plays a critical role in infancy‚Äîbut research suggests adults may see far fewer benefits.
Often called liquid gold for its rich, yellow hue, colostrum is the nutrient-dense fluid mammals produce in the first days after giving birth. In recent years, bovine colostrum‚Äîderived from cows‚Äîhas been increasingly marketed as a dietary supplement with claims that it can reduce the risk of infection and strengthen the gut lining.
However, many scientists are skeptical that a substance intended for newborn calves can actually benefit adult humans. So what does the evidence actually show‚Äîand does colos‚Ä¶

entry.title: You can see Peru's Sacred Valley by bike‚Äîhere's how
entry.summary:
The cycling route from Hucarpay to Pisac weaves between open farmland and rural communities. Riding through Peru‚Äôs Sacred Valley reveals a landscape alive with ritual and renewal, past timeless villages, ‚Äòblessed‚Äô cars and burning fields ‚Äî offerings to the Earth Mother, herself.
This article was produced by National Geographic Traveller (UK).
I‚Äôm 100 metres into a 20-mile bike ride through Peru‚Äôs Sacred Valley and I‚Äôve already come to a halt. My lungs are burning, my heart‚Äôs racing and I‚Äôm wondering if I‚Äôve made a bad decision. At the safety briefing beside Huacarpay Lake, I‚Äôd been champing at the bit to get going, so why do I feel like I have the aerobic fitness of a foetus? It turns out my body isn‚Äôt used to operating above 10,000ft.
I‚Äôve joined a cycling tour that be‚Ä¶

entry.title: Searching for life across the planet‚Äôs frigid frontiers
entry.summary:
Scientist Allison Fong removes an ice core from a floe in the Arctic Circle to sample the microbes that live within. In order to understand the massive changes afoot in the warming polar regions, oceanographer Allison Fong is hunting for the tiniest clues.
Reporting in this article is presented by the National Geographic Society in partnership with Rolex under the National Geographic and Rolex¬†Perpetual¬†Planet Ocean Expeditions.
The northern and southern reaches¬†of our planet are heating up faster than anywhere else on Earth. While researchers already know that the region is poised to change dramatically‚Äîwith ice melting and sea levels¬†rising‚Äîthere‚Äôs a larger question of just what species may survive under those new conditions. Which is how microbial oceanographer ‚Ä¶

entry.title: These unearthly whale songs helped save humpbacks from extinction
entry.summary:
Dappled pair of humpbacks courses through shales of sunlight in warm Hawaii waters. Hugely benign and graceful, humpbacks tolerate author Earle and photographer Giddings as swimming companions. The silence is monumental until the whales begin to sing. Heard at close range, the songs are unforgettable‚Äî resonant and throbbing. ‚ÄúThe sound was incredible, like drums on my chest,‚Äù says Giddings. Once at risk of being wiped out, humpback whales charted a remarkable comeback. What got people to care? Their songs. In 1979 National Geographic issued a record-breaking album. In honor of Project CETI's current work decoding the speech of sperm whales, we're putting the original feature attached to the songs back online.
This story originally published in the January 1979 issue of¬†National Ge‚Ä¶

entry.title: Want to escape Rome's crowds? Visit its underground sites.
entry.summary:
Rome is a city of layers, and it's possible to tour the ancient ruins 30 feet below the surface. From imperial residences to apartment complexes and temples, these hidden sites offer a new window into Rome's layered past.
Sprawling across the valley of the Colosseum and the Palatine and Esquiline Hill in central Rome are the remarkably well-preserved remains of Emperor Nero‚Äôs Domus Aurea, his so-called Golden House. Constructed after the Great Fire of Rome in 64 A.D., it covered at least 100 acres of the city and included landscaped gardens, vineyards, a banquet hall that supposedly rotated day and night, an artificial lake, and hundreds of rooms inlaid with gold, marble, ivory, and precious gems designed to catch and reflect sunlight.
It‚Äôs an ostentatious display of Roman eng‚Ä¶

entry.title: World Bank sees resilient global growth in 2026 amid tariffs but fading dynamism
entry.summary: The global economy is proving more resilient than expected, with 2026 GDP growth expected ‚Äåto improve slightly over forecasts from last June, the World Bank said on Tuesday while warning that growth is too concentrated in advanced countries and overall too weak to reduce extreme poverty.

entry.title: Trade with Iran makes Brazil a target for more US tariffs, data shows
entry.summary: Brazil ran a $2.9 billion trade surplus with Iran last year, government data shows, making the South American nation a potential candidate for new U.S. tariffs.

entry.title: India's smartphone security proposal faces backlash over privacy concerns
entry.summary: The Indian government's plan requiring smartphone makers to share source code as part of a raft of new security measures has drawn criticism from privacy advocates and technology experts over fears of heightened surveillance.

entry.title: Davos begins new era grappling with global order shaken by Trump
entry.summary: Business and political elites head to the World Economic Forum's annual meeting in Davos next week with its vision of a rules-based global economic order being tested to the limits.

entry.title: In Haiti‚Äôs storm-hit south, food vouchers restore choice and dignity for families
entry.summary: Standing outside a colourfully painted building in southeastern Haiti, at the entrance to a bustling shop called Gods Will Depot where bags of food are stacked to the ceiling, Ketia surveys the large pile of groceries she has selected for her family: a big sack of flour, packages of spaghetti, boxed milk, some bars of soap.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: World News in Brief: Escalating fighting in Sudan, displacement in Syria‚Äôs Aleppo, $1.5 billion appeal for South Sudan
entry.summary: More civilians in Sudan continue to be killed and displaced as fighting escalates in multiple parts of the country, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: ‚ÄòA torture that never stops‚Äô: Sri Lanka failing survivors of conflict sexual violence, UN says
entry.summary: Conflict-related sexual violence in Sri Lanka remains largely unaddressed more than 15 years after the end of the civil war, with survivors still denied justice, recognition and reparations, according to a new report by the UN human rights office, OHCHR, on Tuesday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Increase taxes on sugary drinks and alcohol to save lives, urges WHO
entry.summary: Beverages like sugary drinks and alcohol are too accessible and cost too little in most of the world ‚Äì helping fuel obesity, diabetes, cancer and injury, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Tuesday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Iran: ‚ÄòThe killing of peaceful demonstrators must stop,‚Äô UN rights chief says
entry.summary: As anti-government demonstrations continue across Iran, the UN human rights chief said on Tuesday that he was horrified at the mounting violence directed by security forces against protestors, with reports of hundreds killed and thousands arrested.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Gaza: A ceasefire that still kills children is not enough, says UNICEF
entry.summary: Airstrikes, drone attacks and hypothermia continue in Gaza despite the ceasefire, with more than 100 youngsters killed since early October, the UN Children‚Äôs Fund (UNICEF) said on Tuesday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Ukraine war: UN appeals for $2.3 billion to support aid teams‚Äô ‚Äòheroic work‚Äô
entry.summary: Amid ongoing and intensifying Russian attacks across Ukraine, the UN on Tuesday launched a $2.3 billion humanitarian appeal for 2026 to support 4.1 million of the country‚Äôs most vulnerable people.

entry.summary: What matters in U.S. and global markets today

entry.summary: China is hoping President Trump's economic and military actions against other countries will weaken the U.S.-Canada relationship.

entry.summary: Probability expressed as a percentage is a value between 0% and 100%. If‚Ä¶ Tags: Adam Kucharski, uncertainty, words

entry.title: Trump's Iran tariff threat risks reopening China rift
entry.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump's threat to slap a 25% tariff on countries that trade with Iran risks reopening old wounds with Beijing, Tehran's biggest trading partner.

entry.title: Taiwan thanks Canada for its support ahead of prime minister's China trip
entry.summary: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te thanked Canada on Tuesday for its support during recent Chinese military drills and praised the deepening of ties between the two sides, shortly ahead of a visit to China by Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney.

entry.title: Hong Kong trial of media tycoon Jimmy Lai concludes mitigation phase
entry.summary: Hong Kong's High Court wrapped up mitigation hearings on Tuesday for media tycoon and China critic Jimmy Lai, in a final step before the sentencing phase of a years-long national security trial that has drawn international scrutiny.

entry.title: Trump urges Iranians to keep protesting, says 'help is on its way'
entry.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump urged Iranians on Tuesday to keep protesting and said help was on the way, without giving details, as Iran's clerical establishment pressed its crackdown against the biggest demonstrations in years.

entry.title: Renault to sell Geely-based Filante SUV in South Korea from March
entry.summary: Renault will sell its new Filante car in South Korea from March before launching sales in Latin American and Gulf countries by early 2027, it said on Tuesday.

entry.title: Renault to sell Filante SUV based on Geely platform in South Korea from March
entry.summary: French automaker Renault on Tuesday said it will sell its new Filante car in South Korea from March before beginning sales in Latin American and Gulf countries by early 2027.

entry.title: Diageo considering options including sale for China assets, Bloomberg News reports
entry.summary: Diageo is weighing options for its China assets, including a sale, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter, as the world's largest spirits maker looks to streamline its portfolio.

entry.title: India's palm oil imports drop to 8-month low as refiners shift to rival oils
entry.summary: India's palm oil imports fell to an eight-month low in December, as refiners increased purchases of rival oils such as soyoil and sunflower oil amid weaker ‚Äåseasonal demand during the winter months, a leading trade body said on Tuesday.

entry.title: Trump's pick as Vietnam envoy sets sights on trade gap as Hanoi's surplus with US tops China's
entry.summary: The Trump administration plans to replace the U.S. ambassador to Vietnam with a nominee set on addressing "imbalanced" trade relations, as Hanoi's goods trade surplus with Washington surpassed China's in recent quarters.

entry.title: PageGroup shares dip as Europe struggles despite China boost
entry.summary: Recruiter PageGroup posted a smaller-than-feared drop in quarterly profit on Tuesday as China returned to growth, but weakness in Europe raised questions about its dividend and outlook, knocking shares lower.

entry.title: Canadian prime minister visits China after nearly a decade of tense relations
entry.summary: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney departs for China on Tuesday, where he will discuss trade and international security at a time when Canada faces uncertain relations with the U.S. due to a trade war and annexation threats from President Donald Trump.

entry.title: Who are Iran's trading partners facing 25% US tariffs?
entry.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said any country that does business with Iran will face a 25% tariff on trade with the U.S., as Tehran grapples with its most substantial anti-government protests in years.

entry.title: Japan, South Korea push for closer ties to counter regional tension
entry.summary: Japan and South Korea aim to deepen security and economic ties to counter growing tension in East Asia, their leaders said on Tuesday, after a summit meeting in Japan.

entry.title: Former Navy sailor sentenced to 16 years for selling information about ships to Chinese intelligence
entry.summary: A former U.S. Navy sailor convicted of selling ship manuals to an intelligence officer working for China has been sentenced to more than 16 years in prison.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: Sika's full-year sales fall 4.8% on weak China market
entry.summary: Swiss construction chemicals maker Sika reported a 4.8% drop in full-year sales on Tuesday, hurt by a downturn in China and the strength of the Swiss franc.

entry.title: Leaders of South Korea and Japan agree to improve cooperation
entry.summary: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi have agreed to enhance cooperation in economic security, defense and the search for Korean forced laborers' remains.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: Nio pledges to continue to advance business operations in Europe
entry.summary: Chinese electric vehicle maker Nio vowed to continue to advance its business operations in Europe after the European Commission set out the conditions on Monday for China-made EV makers to replace EU tariffs with minimum price plans.

entry.title: Nvidia says no upfront payment needed for its H200 chips
entry.summary: Nvidia does not require upfront payment for H200 chips, a spokesperson for the U.S. chipmaker said in a statement to Reuters on Tuesday.

entry.title: Stocks fall ahead of US inflation data; geopolitics, Fed in focus
entry.summary: Global shares dipped on Tuesday and the dollar recovered some lost ground ahead of U.S. inflation data and major bank earnings, while oil prices gained as unrest in Iran fanned fears for supplies.

entry.title: G7, other allies discuss ways to reduce dependence on Chinese rare earths
entry.summary: Finance ministers from the G7 and other major economies met in Washington on Monday to discuss ways to reduce dependence on rare earths from China, including setting a price floor and new partnerships to build up alternative supplies, ministers said.

entry.title: Trading Day: Trump crosses Fed Rubicon, market shrugs
entry.summary: Investors on Monday brushed aside the dramatic news of the Trump administration's threat to criminally indict Fed Chair Jerome Powell, lifting the S&P 500 to an all-time high, while precious metals also soared to new peaks.

entry.title: FCC revises Verizon phone unlocking rules after significant fraud issues
entry.summary: The Federal Communications Commission revised a long-standing rule that required Verizon Communications to unlock its mobile phones 60 days after activation, which it said is costing the telecommunications company hundreds of millions of dollars annually due to fraud.

entry.title: Germany's finance minister Klingbeil says Washington meeting addressed rare earth price floor
entry.summary: Finance ‚Äåministers from a group of advanced economies meeting in Washington on Monday discussed a possible price floor as well as partnerships to secure strategic rare-earth supplies, Germany's Lars Klingbeil said, adding that many issues remained open.

entry.title: Two Canadian members of parliament end Taiwan trip ahead of Carney's China visit
entry.summary: Two Canadian Members of Parliament are ending a trip to Taiwan early this week ahead of Prime Minister Mark Carney's visit to China, they said in a statement on Monday.

entry.title: DBS suggests investors hedge US dollars and consider low-cost Asian currencies
entry.summary: DBS Group Chief Executive Tan Su Shan on Monday advised investors with heavy U.S. dollar exposure to consider hedging, saying funding costs in Asian currencies are low and regional exchange rates look undervalued.

entry.title: Supertankers sailing to pick up Venezuelan oil for China make u-turn, ship data shows
entry.summary: Two China-flagged supertankers that were sailing to Venezuela to pick up debt-paying crude cargoes amid the U.S. oil embargo on the OPEC country have made u-turn and are now heading back to Asia, LSEG shipping data showed on Monday.

entry.title: US-Taiwan near trade deal to lower tariff, boost TSMC facilities, NYT reports
entry.summary: The Trump administration is nearing a trade deal with Taiwan to reduce its tariff rate to 15% and commit Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corporation to building at least five more facilities in Arizona, the New York Times reported on Monday, citing three people familiar with the matter.

entry.summary: Trump said again that he would like to "make a deal" to acquire Greenland, a semiautonomous region that‚Äôs part of NATO ally Denmark, without suggesting what the deal should be.

entry.title: 10 quirky festivals to plan your year around
entry.summary:
Revelers at the Telluride Mushroom Festival in Colorado dress up in a creative Enoki costume. Shred an air guitar in Finland. Have an epic water fight in Thailand. Slice rival kites from the sky in India. These celebrations invite you to revel in the wacky.
Every January, millions of kites take to the sky over India, dancing and diving in a colorful competition that lasts from dawn until well after dark. In October, 1,500 sheep parade through an Idaho mountain town, bells ringing as ranchers on horseback guide them down Main Street. Finland crowns a world champion for air guitar, where performers shred on instruments that exist only in their imaginations. Deep in the Louisiana bayou, a festival celebrates the Rougarou, the Cajun swamp werewolf, and features a hefty nutria named Neu‚Ä¶

entry.title: Inside Will Smith's most transformative adventure yet
entry.summary: Will Smith, here in Bhutan, trekked all the way from the South Pole to the North Pole in a new docuseries exploring, among many of life's greatest questions, the true meaning of happiness. In a new series from National Geographic, the actor travels the world‚Äîand rethinks what it means to pursue a life well lived. WILL SMITH KNOWS how to push boundaries on-screen, but the actor takes that impulse to literal extremes in his new docuseries, Pole to Pole. The show follows Smith on a 26,000-mile journey from the South Pole to the North Pole, plunging him into some of the most remote environments on the planet‚Äîfrom the heart of the Amazon to the Kalahari Desert. Along the way, Smith joins scientists at the bottom of caves in search of cures for deadly diseases and researchers in f‚Ä¶

entry.title: Everything you need to know about rail travel in 2026
entry.summary:
No matter where in the world your 2026 trips take you, trains are ready to whisk you away. Train services are seeing a renaissance the world over, with fresh routes, new luxury lines and tour operators increasingly focusing on rail journeys. Here‚Äôs the latest for travellers looking to ride the rails in 2026.
This article was produced by¬†National Geographic Traveller (UK).
In light of climate change, flygskam (Swedish for flight shame) and the ease of arriving at a city-centre train station instead of the hassle of a far-flung airport, the world is all aboard for train travel. Adventuring by rail is starting to feel a lot less like a nostalgic throwback and more like stepping into a new era of travel. No matter where in the world your 2026 trips take you, trains are ready to ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Why this neighborhood is called the ‚ÄòBrooklyn of Dublin‚Äô
entry.summary:
The Liberties is home to the Guiness Storehouse, whiskey distilleries, art galleries, and cafes. Defined by its resilience and strong sense of community since the 12th century, The Liberties is attracting modern creatives to its cool, casual vibe.
Famously home to the Guinness Storehouse, The Liberties is likely no stranger to travelers‚Äô Dublin checklist‚Äîbut perhaps only for a quick pint before moving elsewhere like to central Dublin or Portobello.
In the last decade, though, The Liberties has witnessed a modern revival, with artist studios, crafts shops, cafe culture, and new distilleries springing up in centuries-old buildings. Its growth has some locals referring to it as the "Brooklyn of Dublin."
"It‚Äôs gritty, creative, full of soul and right now, it‚Äôs buzzing with th‚Ä¶

entry.title: South Korea president says Japan-China dispute not desirable for regional peace
entry.summary: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said that a dispute between China and Japan was not desirable for regional peace, adding that Seoul would not meddle in the ongoing row.

entry.title: Volkswagen's fourth-quarter deliveries decline as Chinese, US demand softens
entry.summary: German carmaker Volkswagen saw a 4.9% decline in vehicle deliveries in the fourth quarter of 2025, driven by lower demand in North America and China, the company said on Monday.

entry.title: Ukraine: Deadly Russian strikes push civilians deeper into winter crisis
entry.summary: Ukraine has entered the new year under intensifying and deadly Russian attacks which have crippled energy systems and left millions without heating, electricity or water amid freezing temperatures, senior UN officials told the Security Council on Monday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Gaza: Storms worsen already dire humanitarian situation, UN warns
entry.summary: The humanitarian crisis across the Gaza Strip remains extremely serious, with harsh winter weather threatening to reverse recent gains in aid delivery, the United Nations said on Monday.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: UN World Court begins landmark hearings on Rohingya genocide case against Myanmar
entry.summary: Public hearings opened on Monday at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) in a landmark case brought by the Gambia against Myanmar, alleging violations of the Genocide Convention over the military‚Äôs treatment of the Rohingya minority.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Venezuela: UN independent investigators call for immediate release of all political prisoners
entry.summary: More than 100 political prisoners have been released in Venezuela, the Government announced on Monday, just over a week after the seizure and rendition of President Nicol√°s Maduro in Caracas by the United States.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Security Council LIVE: Attacks against Ukrainian civilians unacceptable, unjustifiable and must stop, says UN
entry.summary: The UN Security Council is meeting in emergency session in New York over Russia‚Äôs ongoing deadly missile and drone strikes targeting Ukrainian civilians and energy infrastructure, as frigid winter conditions grip the war-torn country. Millions have been deprived of electricity, heating and water. The UN Secretary-General has called the stepped up attacks an unacceptable violation of international humanitarian law. Follow live below and find all our in-depth meetings coverage here. UN News app users can go here.

entry.title: World News in Brief: Ending famine, refugee solidarity in Kenya, Ukraine civilian casualties update

entry.title: ‚ÄòBeyond GDP‚Äô economists push for clearer metrics on wellbeing, sustainability
entry.summary: Top finance experts are meeting at UN Geneva this week to push for a radical shake up in the way economic growth is gauged, in response to concerns that GDP measurements provide little insight about progress on key sustainability targets that are vital to our survival.

entry.title: As Canada tries to reduce its dependence on the US, its leader will visit China to rebuild ties
entry.summary: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is visiting China this week to mend relations with the world's second-largest economy.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: Vitol, Trafigura offer Venezuelan oil to Indian, Chinese refiners for March delivery, sources say
entry.summary: Vitol and Trafigura have started discussions on Venezuelan crude oil sales with refiners in India and China for cargoes to be delivered in March, several trade sources said on Monday.

entry.title: Ireland says Chinese market has reopened to Irish beef
entry.summary: China has reopened its market to Irish beef imports, dropping a 2024 suspension that followed the discovery of a case of mad cow disease, Ireland's prime minister, Miche√°l Martin, said on Monday.

entry.title: Volkswagen drops to third in China sales as fast-growing Geely Auto overtakes
entry.summary: Volkswagen was overtaken by Geely Auto in sales in China last year, dropping to third place after losing its decade-long dominance in the world's largest auto market to BYD in 2024, industry data showed.

entry.title: EU sets out firm conditions for China EVs to avoid tariffs
entry.summary: The European Commission set out the conditions on Monday under which China-based electric vehicle makers can replace EU tariffs with commitments to sell at minimum prices and said it would take into account Chinese EV investments in the bloc.

entry.title: China and the EU agree on steps to resolve their dispute over EV imports
entry.summary: China and the European Union say they have agreed on steps toward resolving their dispute over the bloc's imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: EU to issue guidelines on Chinese EV minimum price plans, China says
entry.summary: The European Union will issue guidelines on submitting minimum price plans for Chinese exporters of electric vehicles, China's commerce ministry said on Monday.

entry.title: Japan will host summit with South Korea to bolster ties as Tokyo‚Äôs relations with Beijing worsen
entry.summary: Japan‚Äôs Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi will host a summit with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung on Tuesday to ensure stable and friendly ties as her country faces growing tension with Beijing.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: Germany's Merz floats possibility of EU-India trade deal by end of January
entry.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz floated on Monday the possibility that the European Union and India could sign a landmark free trade agreement by the end of January, a move that could reshape global trade ties as protectionism rises and U.S.-India talks remain stalled.

entry.title: Explainer: What is at stake in Uganda's presidential election?
entry.summary: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni will seek to extend his four-decade rule on Thursday in an election that has renewed questions about the 81-year-old leader's eventual succession.

entry.title: Veteran Ugandan leader eyes new term in election amid succession talk
entry.summary: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni is widely expected to extend his four-decade rule in an election on Thursday after a campaign marred by violence and clouded by questions about who might eventually succeed him.

entry.title: Xi stresses the need to win the fight against corruption in China
entry.summary: President Xi Jinping on Monday said China's anti-corruption fight was a battle the country cannot lose, striking a firmer tone in a long-term drive to tackle the graft that has plagued many parts of Chinese society.

entry.title: Trump weighs response to Iran crackdown, Tehran says communication open with US
entry.summary: Trump said the U.S. may meet Iranian officials and he was in contact with Iran's opposition, while piling pressure on its leaders.

author.name: Jana Choukeir, Nayera Abdallah, Tala Ramadan

entry.title: Stocks loiter, gold stands firm as Trump pursues central banker
entry.summary: Wall Street steadied after early losses and the dollar fell, while gold hit a new high on Monday as the Trump administration's threat to indict Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell renewed questions about the future independence of the world's most influential central bank.

'Unhinged' or savvy? Meet Li Chenggang, who leads China‚Äôs trade talks with the US
entry.summary: When U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent described China's lead trade negotiator Li Chenggang as "unhinged" for breaching diplomatic niceties shortly before a critical summit in October, he painted a picture of an erratic junior bureaucrat who had "gone rogue."

entry.title: A guide to Japanese etiquette, from greetings to onsen culture
entry.summary:
Traditional tea ceremonies involve customs that can baffle uninitiated travellers at first. Japanese culture is part of the attraction for travellers, but at times it can feel like there‚Äôs a lot to learn ‚Äî here‚Äôs how to navigate local etiquette.
This article was produced by National Geographic Traveller (UK).
Two things can be true at once ‚Äî and in Japan they usually are. It‚Äôs a land of contradictions and, thanks to this and its reputation for complex, manners-driven culture, visitors can sometimes feel baffled about what‚Äôs the ‚Äòright‚Äô behaviour. While you‚Äôre not expected to know it all, having a basic understanding of local etiquette will make a trip here more relaxing and enjoyable.
Japanese people are punctual and frequently early, so try not to be late to meet gui‚Ä¶

entry.title: Britain is in talks with NATO to counter Russia and China in the Arctic
entry.summary: Britain is discussing with NATO allies how to enhance Arctic security against Russia and China. Transport Secretary Heidi Alexander said Sunday that these talks are routine and not a response to U.S.

entry.title: With Venezuela raid, US tells China to keep away from the Americas
entry.summary: China's progress in Latin America has been an irritant for the U.S.

author.name: Michael Martina, Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom

entry.title: Nordics reject Trump's claim of Chinese and Russian ships around Greenland, FT reports
entry.summary: Nordic diplomats rejected U.S. President Donald Trump's claims of Russian and Chinese vessels operating near Greenland, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.

entry.title: UN chief ‚Äòshocked‚Äô by reports of excessive force against protesters in Iran
entry.summary: The UN Secretary-General is shocked by reports of violence and excessive use of force by Iranian authorities against protesters across the country, urging restraint and the immediate restoration of communications as unrest enters its third week.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: China voices support for Somalia after top diplomat postpones visit
entry.summary: China's foreign minister said Beijing supported Somalia in safeguarding its sovereignty and territorial integrity in a phone call on Sunday with his Somali counterpart, a Chinese ministry statement said.

entry.title: US to push for quicker action in reducing reliance on China for rare earths
entry.summary: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will urge Group of Seven nations and others to step up their efforts to reduce reliance on critical minerals from China when he hosts a dozen top finance officials on Monday, a senior U.S. official said.

entry.title: International law applies to everyone, including US, says German finance minister
entry.summary: The principles of international law apply to everyone, including the United States, German Finance Minister and Vice Chancellor Lars Klingbeil said on Sunday, in reference to President Donald Trump's threats to seize Greenland.

entry.title: Tech companies oppose India's proposal
entry.summary: These are the key security requirements that India is proposing.

entry.title: Exclusive: India proposes forcing smartphone makers to share source code
entry.summary: The plan is part of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's efforts to boost security of user data as online fraud and data breaches increase in the world's second-largest smartphone market.

entry.title: Svitolina downs Wang in Auckland to clinch 19th WTA title
entry.summary: Elina Svitolina was tested by China's Wang Xinyu in the Auckland Open final on Sunday but came through 6-3 7-6(6) to kick off her new season with her 19th WTA title.

entry.title: Greenland‚Äôs harsh environment and lack of infrastructure have prevented rare earth mining
entry.summary: Greenland‚Äôs harsh environment, lack of key infrastructure and difficult geology have prevented anyone from building a mine to extract the sought-after rare earth elements that many high-tech products require.

entry.title: Japan PM Takaichi may call early election, coalition partner says
entry.summary: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi may call an early general election, the head of her party's coalition partner said on Sunday, after media reported she was considering a February vote.

entry.title: What to do in Cortina, a 2026 Winter Olympics host city
entry.summary:
Having previously hosted the 1956 Winter Olympics, Cortina will return to the role this year alongside seven other Italian host destinations. Encircled by a crown of snowy peaks, the ‚Äòqueen of the dolomites‚Äô is gearing up to host the 2026  Winter Olympics, which will bring extra sparkle to this ritzy Italian mountain town.
This article was produced by National Geographic Traveller (UK).
Is this the most spectacularly set town in the Dolomites? There is fierce competition between the eight northern Italian destinations chosen to host the Winter Olympics, but only the wide Ampezzo Valley surrounding Cortina allows for epic street-to-summit views of the craggy massifs, rising like sheer walls from surrounding forest.
Big-name fashion stores like Dior, Prada and Moncle‚Ä¶

entry.title: China is closing in on US technology lead despite constraints, AI researchers say
entry.summary: China can narrow its technological gap with the U.S. driven by growing risk-taking and innovation, though the lack of advanced chipmaking tools is hobbling the sector, the country's leading artificial intelligence researchers said on Saturday.

entry.title: Amidst uncertainty, a helpline in Pakistan becomes a lifeline for Afghans
entry.summary: They ask heartbreaking questions:‚ÄØ‚ÄúWhat will happen to us?‚Äù ‚ÄúIs it true they will deport us?‚Äù‚ÄØ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to go back. How can I live in Afghanistan?‚Äù The words of Sumaiya, who staffs a helpline for refugees and asylum-seekers living in Pakistan but facing the eventuality of having to return to neighbouring Afghanistan.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Built on care and connection: How one Somali-British woman is strengthening diaspora communities
entry.summary: When her family moved from Somalia to London in the 1980s, Safia Jama watched women in her community help her mother navigate a new life in the UK ‚Äî booking doctor‚Äôs appointments, enrolling children in school, and learning how to access everyday services in a new country.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Sudan war leaves millions hungry and displaced as health system nears collapse
entry.summary: Sudan‚Äôs protracted conflict has spiralled into one of the world‚Äôs most severe humanitarian crises, with hunger, displacement and the collapse of basic services exacting a daily toll on civilians.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: Fact-finding mission urges Iran to end protest violence and restore internet
entry.summary: The UN-mandated independent human rights fact-finding mission on Iran has urged authorities to immediately restore internet access and halt the violent crackdown of the ongoing, nationwide protest.

author.name: UN News - Global perspective Human stories

entry.title: At the heart of change: Spotlight Initiative highlights breakthroughs in tackling gender-based violence
entry.summary: When it comes to protecting women and girls from gender-based violence, change happens when they are ‚Äúat the heart of every decision,‚Äù according to Erin Kenny, Global Coordinator of the Spotlight Initiative a United Nations‚ÄìEuropean Union partnership aimed at tackling all forms of abuse against women and girls.

entry.title: Greenland's parliament will bring forward meeting to discuss US threats, party leaders say
entry.summary: Trump says owning Greenland would prevent Russia or China from occupying the territory.

entry.title: China, Russia, Iran start 'BRICS Plus' naval exercises in South African waters
entry.summary: China, Russia and Iran began a week of joint naval exercises in South Africa's waters on Saturday in what the host country described as a BRICS Plus operation to "ensure the safety of shipping and maritime economic activities".

entry.title: Sabalenka returns to Brisbane final with win over Muchova
entry.summary: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka outclassed Karolina Muchova to seal a 6-3 6-4 win at the Brisbane International on Saturday and reach the final of the Australian Open tune-up tournament for the third straight year.

entry.title: Trump: US will do ‚Äòsomething on Greenland, whether they like it or not‚Äô
entry.summary: President Donald Trump said Friday the U.S. will move to take over Greenland "whether they like it or not," arguing American control is necessary to prevent Russia or China from occupying the island.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: Rare mountain gorilla twins just born: 'It‚Äôs kind of miraculous'
entry.summary:
Mafuko, a 22-year-old mountain gorilla, was spotted holding twins, which the park says are both male. The twins were born to a 22-year-old female named Mafuko, who lost her own mother to armed individuals. The extremely endangered species currently numbers at just over 1,000.
With just over 1,000 mountain gorillas left in the wild, any evidence of reproduction is cause for celebration. But the news out of the Democratic Republic of Congo this week is doubly exciting‚Äîa female mountain gorilla named Mafuko was photographed holding a set of male twins in Virunga National Park.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always great when endangered species are having babies,‚Äù says Tara Stoinski, president, CEO, and chief scientific officer for the Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund. ‚ÄúAnd then twins is exciting, because it‚Äôs in‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bessent says Australia, India invited to G7 meeting on critical minerals
entry.summary: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Australia and several other countries would join a meeting of finance ministers from the Group of Seven advanced economies that he is hosting in Washington on Monday to discuss critical minerals.

entry.title: US Commerce Department drops plan to impose restrictions on Chinese-made drones
entry.summary: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Friday it has withdrawn a plan to impose restrictions on Chinese drones to address national security concerns after an earlier crackdown on passenger cars and trucks.

entry.title: US Supreme Court to hear suit claiming Cisco helped China pursue Falun Gong
entry.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Friday to hear an appeal by Cisco Systems in which the tech company and President Donald Trump's administration are asking the justices to limit the reach of a federal law that has been used to hold corporations liable for human rights abuses committed abroad.

entry.title: Trump says US needs to own Greenland to deter Russia, China
entry.summary: The U.S. needs to own Greenland to prevent Russia or China from occupying it in the future, President Donald Trump said on Friday.

entry.title: Global equity funds snap three-week inflow streak
entry.summary: Global equity funds recorded their first weekly outflow in three weeks in the week through January 7 as investors trimmed risk on geopolitical concerns, U.S. rate uncertainty and stretched valuations, especially in U.S. stocks.

entry.title: China's Zeekr brand to enter more European markets, considering hybrid models, executive says
entry.summary: Premium Chinese electric vehicle maker Zeekr will expand into more European markets in 2026, including France, the United Kingdom, Italy and Spain and is considering launching extended-range plug-in hybrids in the region, an executive said on Friday.

entry.title: Garden to glass‚Äîhow cocktail bars are going green
entry.summary:
The Cambridge Public House holds weekly meetings to review sustainability initiatives. From ice-free Martinis to drinks crafted with invasive jellyfish, cocktails are increasingly being shaped by seasons, landscapes and sustainable thinking.
This article was produced by National Geographic Traveller (UK).
Somewhere in Australia, a bartender opens a small jar of fermented citrus and releases the scent of a fruit used to its very last molecule. A syrup made from coffee grounds is folded in. A whisper of carbonation rises as the drink is finished with a cloud of herb oil made from plants grown a few blocks away. The cocktail, relatively low in alcohol, tastes startlingly alive, bright with acidity and is unmistakably influenced by its environment.
Scenes like this are unfo‚Ä¶

entry.title: Headed to the 2026 Winter Olympics? Here's where to stay.
entry.summary:
The 2026 Winter Olympics will take place in Milan and Cortina d‚ÄôAmpezzo, known as the Queen of the Dolomites. While the opening ceremony and most indoor sporting events will take place in Milan, the majority of the outdoor events will be held in the breathtaking Dolomites.
Whether you're traveling here for the Olympics or something else, here's where to stay to enjoy the best of the region.
(All eyes will be on the Dolomites and Milan in 2026. Here‚Äôs why you should visit.)
Alta Badia offers winter sports and culinary delights just 30 miles from the excitement of the XXV Winter Olympic Games. Connected to the Sellaronda ski route, Dolomiti Superski is the driving force in Alta Badia‚Äôs winter culture.
‚ÄúAlta Badia is the ideal solution for those who want to see the Olymp‚Ä¶

entry.title: Meet the man set to break another world record in the North Pole
entry.summary: Polar athlete Richard Parks has completed all seven summits and stood on both the North and South poles in the same calendar year. In National Geographic's new series Pole to Pole, Richard Parks led Will Smith across Antarctica‚Äîon skis. Now he's gearing up for his next adventure. Richard Parks‚Äô hardest climb happened long before he first summited a mountain. In 2009, the polar athlete, then 31, was a professional rugby player at the top of his game. The Welshman had lived and breathed the sport since he was 11, and his dreams weren‚Äôt just in reach‚Äîthey were at hand. Then, an injury and a career-ending surgery changed everything. ‚Äú[The] surgeon told me I'd never play rugby again,‚Äù he recalls. ‚ÄúIt was just devastating. It was as if I fell off the edge of a cliff‚Ä¶

entry.title: This proven diet can lower your blood pressure‚Äîwithin weeks
entry.summary:
The DASH diet emphasizes eating vegetables, whole grains, low-fat dairy, and lean protein while limiting salt and sugar intake. With an emphasis on whole foods, the DASH diet is clinically proven to help improve a host of health issues from diabetes to inflammation.
Every January, scores of diets promise dramatic turnarounds‚Äîbut one has risen above the rest by delivering real, science-backed results.
Developed by researchers at the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute nearly 30 years ago, the DASH diet‚Äîshort for Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension‚Äîwas designed not as a trendy reset or reboot, but as a sustainable way to eat for long-term health.
(Strokes are on the rise‚Äîand these are the reasons why.)
‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs a New Year or any time you‚Äôre ready to impr‚Ä¶

entry.title: 12 evidence-backed tips for reducing inflammation
entry.summary:
From infrared saunas to meditation, there are several steps you can take to reduce chronic inflammation. New research is shedding light on surprising ways to reduce chronic inflammation‚Äîincluding suggestions as simple as flossing your teeth.
It‚Äôs hard to imagine that¬†one of your body‚Äôs life-saving mechanisms could turn against you.¬†But it can and it does happen with inflammation.
Normally, inflammation is beneficial because it is triggered by the immune system to help your body fight off illness-causing germs and repair injured tissue. When the battle is over, inflammation is supposed to cease and desist. If it doesn‚Äôt, it becomes chronic, low-grade inflammation, which is invisible to the naked eye and can have¬†harmful effects.¬†¬†
‚ÄúChronic inflammation corrodes the working‚Ä¶

entry.title: Skip the crowds in Banff and tour this mountain town instead
entry.summary:
Travelers looking for an alternative to popular mountain towns, such as Banff, should consider Kananaskis for outdoor fun, including a hike near Rawson Lake and Mount Sarrail. Just an hour from Calgary, Kananaskis delivers glacier lakes, alpine trails, and luxury mountain lodges, with far fewer visitors.
On a quiet fall morning in Kananaskis, Alberta, just thirty minutes from Banff, an inviting bench beneath trembling aspens offers the perfect place to witness the majestic peaks of Mount Kidd, The Wedge, Fisher Peak, and Mount McDougall. The Village Rim Trail, a loop of less than a mile, circles Kananaskis Village, a purpose-built resort community complete with a hotel, Nordic spa, restaurants, and stores, providing access to the Canadian Rockies and, in the winter, to Kananaskis C‚Ä¶

entry.title: US seizes Olina tanker in Caribbean, fifth vessel taken in Venezuela blockade
entry.summary: The U.S. has seized the Olina tanker in the Caribbean, the fifth vessel targeted in recent weeks as Washington steps up efforts to curb Venezuelan oil exports, U.S. officials said on Friday.

entry.summary: The UN human rights chief has called for an independent and transparent investigation into reports of deaths and widespread arrests during ongoing nationwide protests in Iran, amid mounting concerns over the use of force by security forces.

entry.title: Sudan: After 1,000 days of war, millions of civilians still bearing brunt
entry.summary: Aid agencies marked 1,000 days of war in Sudan on Friday with a grim reminder that the conflict has created the world‚Äôs biggest hunger crisis and largest displacement emergency. entry.summary: The lushly landscaped business park of Rye Canyon is the epitome of a globalized American economy and tariffs are a hot topic.

entry.title: China's top diplomat Wang Yi postpones visit to Somalia
entry.summary: China's top diplomat has postponed what would have been a historic visit to Somalia, part of a tour of Africa aimed at bolstering strategic trade, the East African nation's foreign affairs ministry said on Friday.

entry.title: Physical AI dominates CES but humanity will still have to wait a while for humanoid servants
entry.summary: Just four years after the launch of ChatGPT, the chatbot that brought artificial intelligence into the mainstream, and it seemed like almost every exhibitor at the CES show in Las Vegas this week was touting an AI-powered gadget.

entry.title: Supreme Court set to issue rulings as Trump awaits fate of tariffs
entry.summary: The court may release opinions in argued cases when the justices take the bench during a scheduled sitting at 10 a.m. ET.

entry.title: Red tape on a blue planet
entry.summary: All our laws and rules to protect coral reefs now stand in the way of radical action to save them from heat death - by Irus Braverman Read on Aeon

entry.title: Wingtech pursues international arbitration against Dutch state over Nexperia seizure
entry.summary: China's Wingtech is seeking international arbitration in pursuit of up to $8 billion in damages following the Netherlands' seizure of chipmaker Nexperia, two sources familiar with the legal proceedings told Reuters.

entry.title: Nexperia's Chinese owner Wingtech says it is selecting local wafer suppliers, Caixin reports
entry.summary: The Chinese unit of Netherlands-based Nexperia is selecting local firms to supply it with silicon wafers and is expanding domestic packaging capacity, Nexperia's Chinese owner Wingtech Technology told financial magazine Caixin.

entry.title: BMW reports Q4 sales decline on weaker demand in US and China
entry.summary: German carmaker BMW on Friday reported declining sales in the final quarter of 2025, dragged by weaker demand in the United States and China.

entry.summary: When generic drug manufacturers have issues like contamination, it is difficult for those‚Ä¶ Tags: drugs, generic, prescription, ProPublica

entry.title: More diplomatic and economic tensions surface between China, Japan as a bumpy week ends
entry.summary: A week in which longtime tensions between neighbors China and Japan ratcheted up economically and politically is drawing to a close with no sign of improvements.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: China's December car sales post biggest fall in nearly 2 years
entry.summary: China's car sales fell at the fastest clip in nearly two years in December, as most automakers scrambled to hit their year-end sales targets amid cutthroat competition in the world's largest market.

entry.title: US to provide $45 million to help implement Cambodian-Thai accords
entry.summary: The United States will provide $45 million in assistance to Cambodia and Thailand, the senior U.S. diplomat for East Asia said on Friday during a visit to the region, to help solidify President Donald Trump's peace-making efforts between the two.

entry.title: China tops Japanese public's security worries in latest government poll
entry.summary: The Japanese public now sees China's growing military power as the country's leading security concern, overtaking the threat posed by North Korean nuclear missiles, a government survey released on Friday showed.

entry.title: Venezuela-style strike on Taiwan's leader could prove tricky for China
entry.summary: Some Chinese online users are calling for a lightning Venezuela-style snatch of Taiwan's leaders in a prelude to taking over the island, but analysts, scholars and security officials say China's modernising military is still far from ready.

entry.title: Elevated prices strain retail demand in India; China gold premiums widen
entry.summary: Elevated prices further restricted physical gold buying in India this week, while dealers in China hiked premiums over international rates as retail interest renewed after the holiday period.

entry.title: German exports fall unexpectedly, industrial production rises
entry.summary: German exports unexpectedly fell in November as shipments to other European Union countries and the U.S. dropped, while industrial output rose despite expectations for a decline, official data showed on Friday.

entry.title: Disney CEO meets top Chinese official as 'House of Mouse' navigates US‚ÄëChina tensions
entry.summary: One of China's top officials met with Disney CEO Bob Iger in Beijing on Friday, state media reported, as the "House of Mouse" seeks to strengthen its foothold in the world's second-largest economy amid fraught U.S.-China tensions.

entry.title: Chinese automaker Xpeng touts AI pivot in face of fierce competition
entry.summary: Chinese automaker Xpeng said it wanted to become better known as a ‚Äúphysical AI‚Äù company rather than just a carmaker, as it gears up to launch street trials of robotaxis and start mass producing humanoid robots later this year.

entry.title: Asian shares rise and US futures are flat after modest Wall Street moves
entry.summary: Asian shares have mostly advanced after mixed moves on Wall Street, where President Donald Trump's talk of raising military spending spurred a rally in defense-related shares.

entry.title: Stocks rise ahead of US jobs report, tariff ruling
entry.summary: Global stocks edged higher on Friday ahead of a crucial U.S. report, while investors awaited a Supreme Court ruling on the legality of President Donald Trump's sweeping global tariffs that jolted markets last year.

entry.title: Older swimmers embrace numbing cold by plunging straight into ice water in China
entry.summary: Each year, in the freezing provincial capital of Harbin, in China, people plunge straight into near freezing water. What's more, it's usually the seniors who excel.

author.name: China | Latest News from China Today | AP News

entry.title: China's consumer inflation scales 3-year high but deflation battle far from over
entry.summary: China's annual consumer price inflation accelerated to a 34-month high in December, but the full-year rate slumped to the lowest in 16 years while producer deflation persisted, backing market expectations for more stimulus to shore up soft demand.

entry.title: Countries and industries most exposed to Trump's IEEPA-based tariffs
entry.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court is set to issue rulings on Friday on cases related to the legality of tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.

entry.title: Trump says Venezuela does not give China a Taiwan precedent, but 'it's up to' Xi
entry.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump said "it‚Äôs up to" Chinese President Xi Jinping what China does on Taiwan, but that he would be "very unhappy" with a change in the status quo, according to an interview the New York Times published on Thursday.

entry.title: Trading Day: Defense over tech, payrolls next
entry.summary: Global stocks mostly fell, while oil and Treasury yields rose on Thursday, as investors reacted nervously to U.S. President Donald Trump's call for a huge increase in defense spending and awaited key U.S. employment figures on Friday.

entry.title: 'If it expires, it expires,' Trump tells NYT about US-Russia nuclear treaty
entry.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump indicated he would allow the last U.S.-Russia strategic arms control treaty to expire without accepting an offer from Moscow to voluntarily extend its caps on deployments of the world's most powerful nuclear weapons, according to remarks released on Thursday.

entry.title: Qualcomm to provide infotainment tech for new Volkswagen platform
entry.summary: Volkswagen plans a long-term supply deal with U.S. chip designer Qualcomm to deliver infotainment technology for the German carmaker's new software platform.
